blog.name: aibohponmyg
blog.title: 🧂
blog.description:
Survived the YouTube crash of 2018

RWBY SU Gen: Lock

summary: Overall, this season was pretty good, it definitely had some rough points, but overall, it felt like 3 RWBY seasons mushed into...
caption:
Overall, this season was pretty good, it definitely had some rough points, but overall, it felt like 3 RWBY seasons mushed into one, but cut up to make it feel like just one whole season. The voice cast is pretty decent, but the writing felt a little more on the stale side at times. Dakota Fanning’s character really didn’t get a lot of consideration tbh and wasn’t the best written out of all of the others. 

David Tennant is very good, and his character was well written. Michael B. Jordan made his character come alive, and really brought out the reality of war. Maisie Williams’ character is the Ruby of the show, bringing seriousness, but also a young at heart attitude about a lot of things and that’s very refreshing. The other three are also welcome additions, and each member really brings a new dynamic to the team that in a sense, mixes well. 

I hope that season 2 comes soon! This show truly shows how much Rooster Teeth has come ever since RvB and RWBY.

trail.content:
Overall, this season was pretty good, it definitely had some rough points, but overall, it felt like 3 RWBY seasons mushed into one, but cut up to make it feel like just one whole season. The voice cast is pretty decent, but the writing felt a little more on the stale side at times. Dakota Fanning’s character really didn’t get a lot of consideration tbh and wasn’t the best written out of all of the others. 

David Tennant is very good, and his character was well written. Michael B. Jordan made his character come alive, and really brought out the reality of war. Maisie Williams’ character is the Ruby of the show, bringing seriousness, but also a young at heart attitude about a lot of things and that’s very refreshing. The other three are also welcome additions, and each member really brings a new dynamic to the team that in a sense, mixes well. 

I hope that season 2 comes soon! This show truly shows how much Rooster Teeth has come ever since RvB and RWBY.

summary: A nice little moment I was just reminded of, and thought I might share with fellow dark!Ten enthusiasts: Have a clip out of the...
caption:
A nice little moment I was just reminded of, and thought I might share with fellow dark!Ten enthusiasts:

Have a clip out of the Pest Control audiobook read by DT, where Ten is attempting to hypnotise a Centaur threating him with a gun, (and tell me he doesn’t sound vaguely dark in it…) and enjoying the smooth, low voice.

summary:
Behind the Scenes of The Christmas Invasion (Part 22)  

Excerpts from Doctor Who: The Inside Story:

  “It took me a while to...
caption:
Behind the Scenes of The Christmas Invasion (Part 22)

Excerpts from Doctor Who: The Inside Story:

“It took me a while to realize the BBC wanted fourteen episodes out of us,” Russell [T Davies] admits.  “I’d presumed it was going to be Christmas then a series of twelve. So that was hard for the hardest-working team in the world, but Phil juggled schedules. That’s partly why Series Two included Love & Monsters, which was quite Doctor and Rose-less - that’s the inheritance of The Christmas Invasion, and will always be the case; with Christmas specials we’ll always have to factor that sort of story into each series now.” 

The cheery ‘Song for Ten’ was composed, as always, by Murray Gold.  “Some Phil Spector music had been used as a guide track on the edited episode. The minute I heard that, I realized they’d have to spend more to clear the rights for that than they would spend on the entire music budget, so it had to go.  I always liked Phil Spector, so I thought I’d do a new song in that style. I already had a notebook full of lyrics. I made sure that the line ‘You followed your star, cos that’s what you are’ led into the moment when David Tennant enters the Tyler flat and looks across at Billie Piper. And then she smiles at him, on the line 'I’ve had a merry time with you.’”

Other parts of this photoset: [one] [two] [three] [four] [five] [six] [seven] [eight] [nine] [ten] [eleven] [twelve] [thirteen] [fourteen] [fifteen] [sixteen] [seventeen]
[eighteen] [nineteen] [twenty] [twenty one]
